Authorities announce COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Test requirement for all travelers and returning residents from 7 April (Fiji Sun, 06.04.2022) A pre-departure COVID-19 test is required for all travel to Fiji. The type of test required and the time limit it can be taken before you travel depends on a number of factors including your country of origin, travel route and age. You should familiarise yourself carefully with the latest rules.
Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji and the vaccine must be of a type approved by the Fijian authorities. You will also need to ensure you meet testing and vaccination requirements of your airline and any countries transited on route to Fiji. The Government of Fiji requires travellers coming for tourist purposes to have medical travel insurance that covers COVID-19.

Authorities remove COVID-19 quarantine rule, allow fully-vaccinated visitors to enter country from 7 April (Xinhua, 24.03.2022) Whether entry will be permitted to Fiji and what the process is on arrival will depend on individual circumstances but the major consideration is the countries you have visited or transited in the fourteen days prior to entering Fiji. Fiji has placed all countries into one of three categories: “Travel Partner” countries, which includes the UK ; “Non-Travel Partner” countries; and “Red-List” countries. Full information on the latest rules is available from the Ministry of Commerce, Trade, Tourism and Transport and you should familiarise yourself carefully with these. In some cases approval prior to travel must be sought.

International Restrictions:
*Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19): Fiji’s international border reopened on 1 December 2021. Before travelling to Fiji, all individuals aged 16 or over must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination and evidence of travel insurance along with a pre-booked, professionally administered RAT to be taken within 48 to 72 hours of arrival in Fiji. Fiji’s Ministry of Commerce, Trade, Tourism and Transport has more information on entry conditions. You should carefully check requirements relating your country of departure, transit points and airline or other method of transport.
Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji and the vaccine must be of a type approved by the Fijian authorities. You will also need to ensure you meet testing and vaccination requirements of your airline and any countries transited on route to Fiji. All foreign passport holders must have medical travel insurance with international cover for COVID-19. Valid permit holders are exempt from this requirement but must instead provide a supporting letter from their sponsor or employer confirming they will meet all COVID-19 related costs, including isolation if required. You may transit Nadi Airport if you have a valid ticket, negative COVID-19 test and are fully vaccinated. COVID-19 restrictions are in addition to the regular entry requirements set out below.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Fiji: Although travel restrictions have been eased within Fiji, please ensure you check the latest rules carefully when making travel plans. More information on the latest restrictions are available on the Fiji government website.
*Public places and services: Following the lifting of the majority of COVID-19 restrictions in October 2021, many businesses and public places have reopened. The Government of Fiji has introduced regulations that require all workers in both the public and private sector to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination. Although formal requirements to check proof of vaccination have now eased you may be asked for proof of vaccination when entering businesses, including restaurants, bars and hotels.
